captions.text: [ CROWD CHEERING ]

Hunter:
YOU WANT ME TO STOP IT?

YOU WANT ME
TO STOP THE FIGHT?
NO.

THEN YOU START HITTING HIM
WHEN HE'S RIGHT THERE TO BE HIT.
YOU HIT HIM EVERYWHERE.

YOU HEAR ME?
YOU CAN DO THIS.
[ SPANISH MUSIC PLAYING ]
[ SINGING IN SPANISH ]

Narrator:
THE RETURN OF "CANELO" ALVAREZ

IS CAUSE FOR GREAT CELEBRATION
AT THE MGM GRAND.
BUT IT'S NO MERE HOMECOMING.
THE VENUE ITSELF IS A REMINDER

OF THE WORST NIGHT
IN HIS PROFESSIONAL LIFE --
A MEMORY HE MUST ERASE.

Man: CANELO,
YOU'VE BEEN HERE BEFORE,

BUT YOU'VE NEVER BEEN HERE
WITH A LOSS ON YOUR RECORD.

POSSIBLY CANELO
HAS DOUBTS COMING OFF THAT LOSS.

Man: CANELO, IT SEEMS TO ME
THE LAST COUPLE OF DAYS,

YOU'RE DOING SO MANY INTERVIEWS,
YOU'RE JUST TIRED OF IT.
[ SPEAKING SPANISH ]

THE ONLY THING I WANT
IS NOW.
TO BE ABLE FIGHT

SO THAT I CAN GIVE YOU
ALL DIFFERENT RESPONSES.
Man: CANELO!
CANELO!
[ BELL DINGS ]
Woman: YEAH.
PERFECTO.
[ LAUGHS ]
[ LAUGHS ]

Narrator: ANTICIPATION,
LIKE THE RING ITSELF,
IS BUILT DURING FIGHT WEEK.
IN JUST MINUTES,

A CROWD WILL FLOOD THE ARENA
FOR THE WEIGH-IN.
THE TENSION -- PALPABLE,

UNLESS YOU'RE THE
IMPECCABLY CALM ALFREDO ANGULO,

WHO FINDS
AN UNLIKELY PLACE TO REST.

Hunter: DIFFERENT FIGHTERS
DISPLAY DIFFERENT TEMPERAMENTS
DURING FIGHT WEEK.
BUT I THINK HE'S QUITE LOOSE

AND HE JUST HAS THE PERSONALITY
OUTSIDE THE RING

THAT HE DOESN'T LET THINGS
GET TO HIM.
ALFREDO?
ALFREDO? ALFREDO?

THEY JUST WANT YOU
TO LET HIM SLEEP.

WHY WON'T ANYBODY
LET HIM SLEEP?

Narrator:
IT WOULDN'T BE BOXING

WITHOUT
A LAST-MINUTE COMPLICATION.

I GOT TO
TURN IN THIS CONTRACT.

I HAVE TO ADJUST IT.
I NEED TO ADJUST IT NOW.

WITH CANELO UNABLE
TO MAKE HIS CONTRACTED WEIGHT,

HIS CAMP MUST NEGOTIATE A CHANGE
FROM 154 TO 155.

IT'S JUST A POUND,
BUT IT'LL COST CANELO $100,000,
PAYABLE TO ALFREDO ANGULO

TO ENSURE
THAT THE FIGHT WILL GO ON.
[ CROWD CHEERS ]

Announcer:
ALVAREZ WEIGHS IN

RIGHT AT THE LIMIT
OF 155 POUNDS.
[ CROWD CHEERS ]
THE WEEKS OF GRUELING WORK,

THE MONTHS OF SPECULATION,
IT'S OVER AND DONE.
NO MORE TRAINING, NO MORE TALK.
FIGHT NIGHT HAS FINALLY ARRIVED.

Kenny: TONIGHT, CANELO ALVAREZ
BACK TO RESUME AND RECHARGE

WHAT HE STILL EXPECTS
TO BE A SUPERSTAR CAREER.
HE SAYS HIS GOAL

IS STILL TO BE ONE OF THE BEST
IN BOXING HISTORY.
[ CHUCKLES ]
[ CROWD CHEERING ]

Lennon Jr.: INTRODUCING
ALFREDO "EL PERRO" ANGULO!

Ranallo:
AND THE CHANTS OF "PERRO"

BEGIN TO REVERBERATE
THROUGHOUT THE MGM GRAND.
I KNOW. IT'S PERFECT.

AND NOW HERE IS THE FORMER
UNIFIED WORLD CHAMPION

FROM GUADALAJARA,
SAUL "CANELO" ALVAREZ!

THE QUESTION IS, HOW WILL CANELO
BOUNCE BACK TONIGHT?
[ CROWD CHANTS "CANELO" ]
THE CROWD SAYS IT ALL.

THE DUELING CHANTS OF "CANELO"
AND "EL PERRO" --

THE TWO SIDES TRYING
TO DROWN EACH OTHER OUT.

COME ON,
PERRO.
CANELO! CANELO!

Ranallo: NO TITLES
ARE ON THE LINE TONIGHT.

IT'S ALL ABOUT PRIDE, AND THEY
COME OUT THROWING BOMBS.

DON'T PLAY WITH HIM.
BE QUICKER.

Bernstein: CANELO THROWING
COMBINATIONS EARLY,

AND THAT'S A GOOD SIGN
FOR HIM.

THAT'S WHAT
HE WANTS TO DO --

USE HIS HAND SPEED,
WHICH IS BETTER THAN ANGULO'S.

Malignaggi: PERRO HAS TO GET BY
AN EARLY ASSAULT FROM CANELO

AND HOPE
TO SLOW HIM DOWN.

CANELO ROCKING THE HEAD
WITH THE RIGHT HAND.
UGH!

AND THUS FAR,
IT'S ALL CANELO.

IT'S BEEN
A SPIRITED AFFAIR.

WE DID NOT EXPECT
ANYTHING LESS.

LOOK AT ME.
IS HIS PUNCHES BOTHERING YOU?

Angulo:
A LITTLE BIT.

Malignaggi: ANGULO JUST
STAYING COMPOSED, THOUGH,

DESPITE TAKING
THIS ASSAULT.

Bernstein:
THE RIGHTS TO THE BODY

AND THE LEFTS TO THE BODY
NOT GETTING THERE FOR ANGULO.

Ranallo: HE IS ABSORBING
TREMENDOUS PUNISHMENT, THOUGH,

AT THE HANDS
OF CANELO ALVAREZ.

THE BIG PROBLEM
IS ANGULO'S GETTING NO LEVERAGE

ON ANY OF PUNCHES, AND THAT'S
CERTAINLY TROUBLESOME.

Berto:
HE GONNA KEEP COMING, THOUGH.

THAT'S THAT DOG,
BABY.

CANELO'S OFF
TO A QUICK START,

BUT HE ALWAYS HAS ISSUES
LATER IN FIGHTS.
AND LET'S BE HONEST.

HE DIDN'T QUITE MAKE WEIGHT,
DID HE?

HE'S GETTING TIRED.
HIS HANDS ARE DOWN.

THERE'S A LEFT HOOK
TO THE BODY,

RIGHT HAND UPSTAIRS
BY ANGULO.

NOW ANGULO LOOKING
TO PUT THE PRESSURE ON CANELO.

RAPID-FIRE COMBINATION
FROM CANELO.
HE CAN TAKE A SHOT.

WE'VE SEEN THAT
THROUGHOUT HIS CAREER.

I JUST HOPE
HE DON'T SWELL UP.

ANGULO'S EYES
BEGINNING TO SWELL --

PAR FOR THE COURSE, THOUGH,
WHEN HE'S IN THE RING.
OKAY, LISTEN.

HE'S TAKEN
SOME HARD SHOTS.

I'M NOT GONNA LET THIS HAPPEN
ALL NIGHT.

HE'S ONLY GETTING
ONE PUNCH AT A TIME.

YOU HAVE TO ADMIT,
TONY,

THAT IT'S LESS
THAN WHAT IT'S BEEN.
Weeks: OKAY.

YOU HAVE TO ADMIT THAT.
AND HE'S STILL FIGHTING.

I'M JUST GONNA
JUST CAUTION.
I'M JUST CAUTIONING.

Bernstein: TONY WEEKS
ACTUALLY WENT INTO THE CORNER

AND SAID SOMETHING ABOUT THE
AMOUNT OF SHOTS ANGULO'S TAKING,

THOUGH I CAN'T IMAGINE
ANYBODY'S GONNA BE THINKING

ABOUT THIS FIGHT
BEING STOPPED TOO SOON.

YOU ALREADY UGLY, SON,
ANYWAY RIGHT NOW.

YOU PRETTY
WHEN YOU HEAL.

YOU GO OUT THERE.
YOU FINISH THIS, MAN.

YOU HEAR ME,
SON?

Malignaggi: I FEEL LIKE THE
GAME PLAN BY CANELO IS GENIUS.

IT'S JUST,
CAN HE KEEP THIS UP?

PERRO! PERRO!
THERE YOU GO.

Hunter:
LET THOSE STRONG HANDS GO, DOG.

LET THOSE
GIFTED HANDS GO.
DO IT!

YOU CAN DO IT,
SON.

TURN THIS AROUND,
SON.
THIS IS YOURS.

IT'LL BE THE GREATEST FIGHT
IN HISTORY.

Bernstein: THERE IS ALMOST NO
OTHER WAY TO SCORE THIS FIGHT.

CANELO ALVAREZ
HAS CERTAINLY WON EVERY ROUND.

THEY THOUGHT
THESE WOULD BE THE ROUNDS

WHEN HE MIGHT MAKE SOMETHING
HAPPEN AGAINST CANELO ALVAREZ.

SO FAR,
IT HASN'T.

Ranallo:
NOW ANGULO PUTTING TOGETHER

A COMBINATION
OF HIS OWN.
WORK! WORK!

THAT WAS PROBABLY
THE BEST COMBINATION

HE'S REELED OFF
IN THIS FIGHT.

AND THERE, ANGULO URGING CANELO
TO BRING IT,

AND IT'S BEEN HIS CALLING CARD
FOR ANGULO,

WILLING TO EAT TWO OR THREE
PUNCHES TO GIVE ONE OF HIS OWN.
KEEP GOING!

TIME TO EAT,
BABY!

KEEP GOING!
IT'S TIME TO EAT!

CANELO'S BEEN BRINGING IT
ALL NIGHT LONG.

BUT NOW ANGULO COMING FORWARD
WITH HIS BEST COMBINATION.

CANELO'S SAYING,
BRING IT ON.

THE MACHISMO
IN EFFECT.

THIS IS MAKING IT ENTERTAINING
IN THIS ROUND, THOUGH.
TERRIFIC PACE.

THIS IS WHAT WE THOUGHT
WE WOULD SEE.

CANELO, ANGULO,
VIVA MEXICO!

THIS IS NOW THE TOE-TO-TOE
WE'VE BEEN LOOKING FOR.

THAT'S WHAT
I WANT TO SEE.

THAT'S WHAT
I WANT TO SEE.

Malignaggi:
CANELO RELAXED IN THAT CORNER.

HE LOOKED OVER AT ME
AND WINKED.

THAT'S JUST SAYING,
"I GOT THIS."

Ranallo: CANELO LOOKS VERY MUCH
LIKE THE FIGHTER

WHO WAS ON
THAT TERRIFIC RISE BEFORE

RUNNING INTO THE POUND-FOR-POUND
KING LAST SEPTEMBER.

ANGULO, THE POLAR OPPOSITE
OF FLOYD MAYWEATHER.

HE'S RIGHT THERE
IN FRONT OF CANELO ALVAREZ.

BEAUTIFUL COMBINATION --
THE SPEED, THE CRISPNESS.

CANELO CONTINUES TO BATTER AWAY
ON ALFREDO ANGULO.
COME ON, PERRO!
OH, MY GOD.

HE'S NOT EVEN LOOKING
AT ANGULO.
TAKING A MOMENTARY BREAK.
LOOK AT ME.

DO YOU WANT ME
TO STOP THIS FIGHT?
NO.

I WILL STOP
THIS FIGHT.

ALFREDO, YOU GOT TO
TURN IT AROUND THIS ROUND.
IT'S ROUND 10.

I KNOW
YOU CAN DO IT,

BUT I'M NOT GONNA LET
THIS HAPPEN TO YOU, SON.

Ranallo: VIRGIL HUNTER
SHOWING CONCERN FOR HIS FIGHTER.

ANGULO WITH A MOUSE
UNDER HIS LEFT EYE,
SWELLING AROUND BOTH EYES.

THERE'S A LEAD
LEFT UPPERCUT.

AND REFEREE
HAS STOPPED THIS FIGHT.

I'M SORRY.
I'M SORRY.
[ CROWD BOOS ]

WOW.
ANGULO CRESTFALLEN.
VERY DISAPPOINTED.
[ ALL CHEERING ]
WHAT THE...?!

THE CROWD DOESN'T LIKE IT,
BUT IT'S OFFICIAL.
BOO!
[ CROWD BOOING ]
[ CHEERING ]
HE WAS NOT WOBBLED.

HE WAS NOT HURT.
ALFREDO!
ALFREDO!

NO,
DON'T GO.

DON'T GO.
YOU CAN BE PROUD OF YOURSELF.

HE WAS WRONG
FOR STOPPING IT.

Angulo:
IT'S BULLSHIT, MAN.

EL PERRO,
I'M PROUD OF YOU.
HE SHOULDN'T HAVE STOPPED IT

BECAUSE I TOLD HIM
THAT I WOULD STOP IT.

THERE WAS NO REASON TO STOP.
HE'S FINE.

Bernstein:
THE QUESTION, I GUESS,

YOU HAVE TO ASK YOURSELF IS,
IS IT APPROPRIATE FOR A REFEREE

TO STEP IN AND STOP IT,
MAKING A JUDGMENT CALL?

I'M TORN
BY THE DECISION.

I'M 50-50.
I AM, AS WELL.

LOOK,
THE KID FOUGHT A GREAT FIGHT,

BUT YOU DON'T STOP A FIGHT
'CAUSE HE WAS IN THE FIGHT.

HE WAS IN THE FIGHT,
OKAY.

ONLY ONE UPPERCUT THAT HE BEEN
GETTING HIT WITH ALL NIGHT LONG.
TONY, TONY.

I RESPECT
WHAT YOU'RE SAYING.

YOU'RE A FIGHTER.
YOU'RE A TRUE CHAMPION.

I RESPECT
EXACTLY WHAT YOU'RE SAYING.

MY THING IS,
I'M -- I'M NOT IN YOUR HEAD.

I DON'T KNOW
WHAT'S GOING ON.

ALL I SEE --
ALL I SEE IS THE PUNISHMENT.

I'M JUST GLAD
YOU'RE OKAY.

Lennon Jr.: HE IS THE WINNER
BY WAY OF TECHNICAL KNOCKOUT,
SAUL "CANELO" ALVAREZ!
[ CROWD BOOS ]

Ranallo: A TERRIFIC PERFORMANCE
BY CANELO ALVAREZ.
[ CRYING ]
IT'S OKAY.
IT'S OKAY.
IT'S OKAY.
[ CROWD CHANTS "PERRO, PERRO" ]
[ CHANTING CONTINUES ]

Hunter:
THAT PUNCH RIGHT THERE.

NOW,
LOOK HOW HE GOES BACK.

LOOK HOW HE LOOKING AT HIM
AND LAUGHING AT HIM.

HE WASN'T EVEN HURT.
NOT EVEN HURT.
I DON'T LIKE FIGHTS LIKE THIS,

BUT YOU GOT TO ACCEPT WHO HE IS
AND GIVE HIM HIS CHANCE.

[ SPEAKING SPANISH ]
CHARLESTON.

WATCH YOUR HEAD
GETTING IN.
Man: WHOO!

Announcer:
SAUL "CANELO" ALVAREZ.
NOT JUST A WIN, BUT A STATEMENT.
[ CROWD CHANTS "CANELO" ]
[ DRAMATIC MUSIC PLAYS ]

-- Captions by VITAC --
 www.vitac.com

comments.author: JRLM

comments.text:
La verdad no entiendo porque desacreditan tanto a Canelo, Todavia no tiene 
victorias grandes es cierto pero el aun esta empezando... No se dejen 
llevar por el record, No es lo mismo ganarlas en tu país que a nivel 
mundial, Un claro ejemplo de eso fue Hatton que fue destruido al venir a 
USA. Almenos Canelo se gano a Mosley y Trout que ya son 2 boxeadores de 
Clase B+ o A- . Ademas lo que importa es el dominio que demuestre en el 
ring, Y lo hace perfectamente... Solo se enfocan en su derrota y acaso 
creen que le toco pelear contra un Don nadie? Nonono, Le toco contra el #1 
P4P y posiblemente uno que cae en los primeros 50 mejores de todos los 
tiempos. Si les molesta que pelio con Angulo pues les informo que esa es la 
idea Tomar un oponente sencillo para poder subir con una victoria 
impresionante y asi recuperar tu derrota, Siempre ha sido asi, Se necesita 
una escalera para poder subir y mejorar tu carrera, Como estan utilizando 
en estos tiempos a Soto Karaas, Judah y Malignnaggi.﻿
comments.author: Tempest Baez

comments.text:
Canelo is a worthless fighter, didn't show any urgency when he was clearly 
losing to Mayweather.  But when he's fighting a washed up fighter like 
Angulo, he shows courage and willingness to fight.  If he wasn't born with 
white skin and red hair, he would be like any other Mexican, starving and 
crossing the border illegally to earn himself a living with dignity.﻿
